version_name: 1.06- Fixed a bug that was causing a ton of reminders to appear at once for some people. I'm really sorry if this caused you problems

version_description: Fixed an issue with calculating dates that was adversely affecting some very patient users.

Increased the number of activities you can track to 12.
Removed the vertical day view, to focus the app on the main monthly calendar view.
Visual improvements to the dark color scheme, app icon, and settings screens.
Improved stability when launching the app from a reminder notification.
New and better data storage, leading to faster scrolling and activity editing.

Increased the number of activities you can track to 12.

Visual improvements to the dark color scheme, app icon, and settings screens. Improved text readability in certain screens.
Improved stability when launching the app from a reminder notification.
New and better data storage, leading to faster scrolling and activity editing.

Updated reminder notifications so that each reminder links to the day it was issued. So if you get a reminder on Wednesday, and tap it just after midnight, it will load Continuo with the input box for Wednesday, not Thursday.
Fixed a bug that caused a crash when tapping a reminder notification after midnight, if the app was still in memory from the previous day.
Minor timing tweaks.
Several minor fixes relating to startup, and some animation improvements.
While Continuo is active, if you pull down Notification Center and tap a reminder notification, it now pops up the input box for that day.
Improved the appearance and positioning of calendar elements.

This version contains:

- A major UI refresh, with nicer colors, a better layout, fun icon animations, and more
- An option to show the days of the week (in settings)
- A completely rewritten codebase for improved speed and stability
- An Apple Watch app

I hope you like the update, and feel free to direct any comments to naftali@continuoapp.com.
Increased the widths of calendar bars, plus some other minor tweaks.
Small tweaks to the UI.

- Fixed a small capitalization bug for displaying activities
- Minor database update
- Watch now syncs more reliably

- Improved date handling for faster loading.
- Calendar can now scroll infinitely back in time.
- Smoothed out in-app purchase error handling.

- Made some colors in dark mode more visually distinctive from each other
- Fixed an in-app purchase bug
- A few UI tweaks
- The Watch app is now more reliable and loads more quickly
Minor bug fixes.

Many bug fixes and performance improvements, and an awesome new color mode feature. Set the color scheme to "auto" and enable your location, and Continuo will launch in dark mode between sunset and sunrise.

(Note: Your location is kept private on your device, and only used to determine your local sunrise and sunset times. Continuo doesn't upload it anywhere.)

If you like the app and the updates, please give it a rating on the App Store. Thanks for your support!

- The unlocked app now supports an unlimited number of activities (compared with the old limit of 12).
- There is a new statistics screen that shows streaks and other useful information about activities.
- Many parts of the app have been rebuilt for faster startup and smoother animations.
- The iPhone X layout is now supported.
Fixed a small startup bug.
Updated dark color scheme for the iPhone X.

Colors! Lots of new colors, including a new array of grayscale options. I did my best to match the old palette to the new one, but if any of your existing activities look a little different, I apologize, and feel free to adjust its color.

Improved visual layout on iPhones of the "X" variety.

Also, you can now track up to three activities for free, not just one. To my customers who made the purchase because you wanted to track more than one activity, I really appreciate your support.

- Added enhancements to the speed and responsiveness of the activity menu, including more reliable reordering and nicer scroll/drag handling.
- If you start dragging a bar for a daily activity, and move your finger up or down during the drag, it will continue editing the original activity - no matter where you move your finger during the drag.

Updates to the color picker!

- You can now choose among a wider range of saturations and brightnesses.
- The interface has been simplified to make it easier and faster to find the color you're looking for.
- On the activity color screen, you can now drag the scroll indicator to quickly find the color you want (or tap it to return to the currently selected color).

I also fixed a bug relating to data migration from an old version of the app.

Thanks for your support!

- You can now permanently delete activities from the Archived screen - just press and hold the 'Delete' button for a few seconds.
- To dismiss the "today" popup without saving the entered data, you can now tap on the darkened background outside of the modal.
- Improved some button and tooltip colors for both light and dark color schemes.
